website_summaries.verdict: This contender is an inexpensive purchase, but it may be less durable than some competitors.
pros: Safe for dishwasher and all cook tops
cons: Occasional complaints about leakage (from the bottom) and interior rust

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY-  see pics
customer_reviews.text: This bottom of the tea kettle chipped and I did not realize I had been drinking metal that had been chipping from the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: This kettle is 5 months old and it is already useless. The whistling spout melted and fell off this ...
customer_reviews.text: I would give this kettle 0 stars if that was an option. This kettle is 5 months old and it is already useless. The whistling spout melted and fell off this morning. Use of this kettle in my home is minimal as only my wife uses it to boil water for tea in the mornings. I have had many kettles in the past and all have last for years. But this one...5 months? Do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Deyoe

customer_reviews.title: Finish does not last!
customer_reviews.text: I loved the red color! If you use your on the stove teapot a lot, then this is not the teapot for you! If you cook, then grease and stuff will get on it! When you wash it, the red comes off! Then you wind up with a silver teapot! If you don't wash it, it is greasy and nasty looking, and who wants that in the kitchen? Then, there is red paint all over your dishcloth, and you are wondering what the paint has in it. Nah, get ceramic or something, but not this one! My daughter in law has the same one, and hers did the same thing! Don't spend your money on this! Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Connie Cook

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price and cheap quality.
customer_reviews.text: The body part of this item was good as it describer, but the lid and top area attach lid was poor qualities. The Lid get stain and brown oxidant around the lid ring in couple months used. I contact company for replace a new lid the second one get the same problems in a month later. Disappoint with that bad quality, I don't want to contact again because of not satisfied at all with customer services. Any way cheap price product and not worth for spend time to call, took so long time to call a round to get in-touch, waiting so long with each number they past around to the right place answering.
customer_reviews.author: KATINA

customer_reviews.title: Do Not  Buy This - Paint Peeled in One Week!
customer_reviews.text: I love the look but after just a week a chunk of paint peeled off. I was very careful with it, realizing it might be easily scratched. But, a drop of water dried on the outside. This caused the paint to come off - honest, I didn't scrub or anything, it just came off! Also, my gas burners (not an old stove either) turned the red a dark color. I didn't even try to clean it given that a drop of water peeled the paint. Very pretty if you only want a teapot that lasts a week or is just for display.
customer_reviews.author: Greek Lady

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews, but I received this product October 6th and have had it approximately a month and a half. Already it is rusting along the bottom inside, along the top of the lid and it is eroding on the very bottom inside. This hot water kettle, at least the one I received, is a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: kristen

customer_reviews.title: Only partially stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: I really wanna like this tea kettle. Follow the instructions and washed with hot soapy water. Are use it to make some tea, after the first use even after rinsing and storing on top of stove with it off, I had black spots inside on the bottom in the morning. So I got a magnet out and the only part that isn’t magnetic is the sides. The bottom is regular steel and very magnetic. For those who don’t know stainless steel is not magnetic.
customer_reviews.author: erich bastel

customer_reviews.title: Awfully flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: When you take it out of the box, you can't believe how light it is. That's because of the thinness of the metal. I bought it for a friend and I'm a little embarrassed by how cheap it feels - can't imagine that it will last for long. Also, it's a bit tough lifting the whistler spout without burning your fingers. And the handle has these tiny tabs to keep it from falling over when you tilt the kettle to pour, but there's an art to it, or else the thing will topple over sideways. Hard to explain. Buy one...then you'll see what I mean, hah!
customer_reviews.author: B Toan

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made plastic handle won't last
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made. It served it's purpose for about 2 months, until the handle spring popped out. I was unable to get the spring back in, but could still open and close the spout. Then while washing it today, the cheap plastic handle piece broke, now it is completely useless. Next time I will purchase a cast iron kettle. This is made in China plastic mechanism crap.
customer_reviews.author: Just Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Astounding
customer_reviews.text: Smells of echinacea and chamomile wisp past my nostrils as I write this review. For the amount of money spent on this product, I'd say this is a golden nugget I've found across the vast virtual plains of Amazon. If you enjoy drinking tea or coffee, I highly recommend you purchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice kettle
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this kettle was way more sturdy than I was expecting. I bought it to use with my first french press and it works just as a kettle should. As a bonus, it looks very stylish sitting on my stove so it's just going to stay there!
customer_reviews.author: Monica Love

customer_reviews.title: Loud...and I don't mean the whistle.
customer_reviews.text: I should say I'm not sure what I expected, but there's no way to make tea or heat water in this thing without everyone knowing. I'm not talking about the whistle (which is unnecessary because you can literally hear the stages up to and including boil). Loud is an understatement. I guess because it's steel and not insulated? I didn't realize this was a factor. A teapot is a teapot, right? Well, now it's a flowerpot.
customer_reviews.author: bluelotus

customer_reviews.title: Not a good purchase. Leaks steaming hot water
customer_reviews.text: Appearance wise, its awesome. love the look, love the color, easy swing handle...but whats its purpose? to pour hot steamy water from the spout into your cup. Every use is a clean up. it drips hot steaming water out the lower part of the spout while pouring out the top. Ive tried twisting, tightening...everything, it still leaks a mess of hot steamy water all over my counter. We have children that i always need to make sure stand way back so i can enjoy a cup of coffee in the morning. so disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: D Brennen

customer_reviews.title: OK Kettle
customer_reviews.text: This kettle has a nice design and a wide base that heats quickly. The handle is on a hinge -- maybe so you can move it out of the way to add water. That means, when you tip the kettle to pour out the hot water, the handle bends and the hot kettle fall over onto your hand. With that in mind, I pour very carefully now. Sometimes the kettle whistles when it boils, but sometimes it does not. so be sure to set a timer. Hope that helps. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Churchill

customer_reviews.title: Rust within 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I thoroughly dried it out (as best as possible) after each use, and after nearly a year the bottom rusted. After about 6 months the bottom started showing very minor signs of pitting and minor rust. I would recommend getting something better; maybe something built in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Lasted just past return date then broke while boiling water
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had taken a picture of what happened with the handle-first a skrew popped out then the handle fell over and melted to side of kettle. Now I no longer have a tea kettle. This all happened while I was sitting in living room waiting to hear the whistle. But by then the kettle was a melted piece of handle on side of kettle and unable to pick up and pour water. This all happened right after return date expired-figures right cause now I'm out 30 dollars and no tea kettle
customer_reviews.author: Definately 5stars by Vicki Nelson

customer_reviews.title: A lot of people don't like the loud obnoxious whistle
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as expected. The whistle isn't very loud though. So, you could could that as a plus or a minus, depending on what you're looking for. A lot of people don't like the loud obnoxious whistle, but I was really looking for that, since we have a tendency to put the kettle on and then forget about it. (And my house is chaotically loud at pretty much all hours of the day, so I really needed that piercing squeal lol)
customer_reviews.author: MyLove Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Great low cost pot
customer_reviews.text: Great low cost tea kettle. Heats up very quicly and boils the water faster than expected. It whistles moderately loud but not overbearingly annoying to go near to take it off the heat. My only complaint is that while it is heating up it is very very loud with the heat on the bottom of it. The normal "heating pan" noise is very very loud and could wake up people sleeping if not careful. Also it stays very warm for a long time. Ive boiled water and gone back a couple hours later and it was still fairly hot.
customer_reviews.author: ECW813

customer_reviews.title: Defective, cheap quality, melts quickly
customer_reviews.text: I bought a whistling teapot-according to the advertisement and specs.. It doesn't whistle. What it does is boil the water, melts the handles, and discolors the pot, just while you're waiting for the whistle to sound, it's melting and getting too hot. By the time it does whistle, the lid was melted to a puddle and the handle was so incfredibly hot that it burned my pregnant daughter's hand to the point where we had to rush her to emergency for second degree burns. This is not a safe item to use. It needs to be removed from the market
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: I really like the design but the function is poor and someone ...
customer_reviews.text: EXTREMELY DANGEROUS. The spout splashes boiling hot water all over the place including on the hand holding it) as you pour from the kettle, and the kettle boils over before whistling (which just caused damage to my new stovetop :( :( :( ). I really like the design but the function is poor and someone is going to hurt themselves trying to use this. Not sure of the origin of manufacture but I'd highly recommend going with a different one in order to prevent injury or damage. So disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeping me in (and out) of hot water!
customer_reviews.text: I am a tea drinker - I like my tea water HOT! To add to the issue are how cold the mugs are when they are in the cabinet in the winter - pouring water in there instantly cools off the tea before milk is added. Also, I forget often that I have put on the tea water or forget to turn it off. My problems are solved with this tea kettle. The mugs are warmed up and my tea is still piping hot. I can leave my home or go upstairs free of the nagging doubt of whether or not I turned off the stove.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: Good overal!
customer_reviews.text: Update Dec 27,2018: It has not rust. The handle is still strong and working. The whistle still works! I will buy more when this one gives out. Pros: Whistles when its ready Has a cutte shape Has not rust yet (1 month in) Nice sturdy handle Cons: hard to open at times Get this for yourself you wont regret it :)
customer_reviews.author: The Garrisons

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to listen to the 5 star reviews- I knew I was getting into a cheap kettle- but WOW is this thing cheap. The metal is extremely thin, the handle and spout are so tight I feel like if I move them they will rip off, it makes this horrible sound as its heating up water. Does it heat up water? YES! Am I on here purchasing another one after a few weeks? YES! I couldn't take it anymore- trash it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis h

customer_reviews.title: Save a nickle lose a dollar...
customer_reviews.text: It's funny because I'm looking for a new teakettle to replace this piece of junk when I saw it advertised I just had to rate it. I only paid $6 for it (shame on me). It doesn't whistle every time, it's so flimsy and it gets so hot that you need an oven mitt or a towel to pick it up after it starts boiling, and the screw holding the handle has come off making it too dangerous to use. That's why I'm online right now, to buy a teakettle to replace this hunk of junk.
customer_reviews.author: BigT

customer_reviews.title: Nice Design
customer_reviews.text: This pot is light weight. To me, it`s a very safe design, The cover is large enough to put my hand in and clean it. Finally found a good affordable tea pot.
customer_reviews.author: mufffin

customer_reviews.title: Oxidizes too quickly
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this a short time but there is already oxidation on the inside. Water wasn't even in very long. Also the handle gets very hot despite that it's supposed to be heat resistant. Overall disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Gargangel

customer_reviews.title: Noisiest kettle ever!
customer_reviews.text: Although it is very pretty, this is the noisiest pot I have ever used. As soon as the fire is lit underneath, it starts making a loud cracking noise that continues the entire time it is on the fire. And the whistle is so low that I have to be right next to it to hear it whistle and even then I wonder if it is whistling. And yes, the water is boiling and steam is coming out when I open the spout to pour it out. I would return it if it wasn't such a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous!!!!
customer_reviews.text: DANGER!!! DANGER!!! HANDLE IS NOT HEAT RESISTENT AND MELTED! SHAME ON MR. COFFEE!!! The damage to the handle in the attached pictures is the mark my finger made in the handle when I picked up the teapot! The teapot had just started to whistle when I picked it up. This is only the 7th or 8th time I have used it. My finger now has a 1st degree burn. The handle is not able to rest on the pot. The fire on my largest burner is smaller than the diameter of the pot. This is purely the result of a poorly made product!
customer_reviews.author: ann m matson

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: In 4 months the kettle is rusting out. I notice rust spots on the lid and today I see that the inside where the bottom of the pot meets the side is all rusted. I've also come close to burning myself when picking it up because the Whistle blows steam out the sides of the spout or if you have it positioned wrong up along the handle. Don't waste your money on this!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Should have heeded previous reviews
customer_reviews.text: Not my favorite teapot....previous teapots whistle almost after a couple of minutes...the first 3-4 times I used this I thought maybe it didn’t whistle then one night I forgot about it and it started whistling and I went in and it wasn’t only whistling it was spitting water all over my stovetop
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Cheap construction design
customer_reviews.text: The handle has a little bolt on it with a really small but on the inside to hold it. This nut will not stay on. I have tighter it by hand, wrench, and screwdriver and it still falls off. It may be cheap but spend a little more and get some better quality. Personally I bought a cast iron one. It doesn’t whistle but you don’t have the problem either.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Junk!  You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: Sorry...but this is the worst quality tea kettle ever. It's almost like a toy. I have used it 3 times and it is already broken. The lid is almost impossible to put back on...the handle is not firm....so when you are heating it up, it hangs down and gets hot and melted. The whistle lever melted off. It was cheap, but I bought it hoping the Mr. Coffee name would be a good testament to quality. It is now outside with the play toys. Terrible purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert N. DeHaven

customer_reviews.title: Good quality at a fair price
customer_reviews.text: Good basic tea kettle. I had a much more ornate one that looked fabulous but the handle and spout got so hot I would burn my hand. And the water sputtered all over when pouring as it boiled again by the spout. No issues with this one. Good quality, fair price, and it does what it is supposed to do! Brushed stainless resists smears and smudges so it looks cleaner longer.
customer_reviews.author: JoTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Cute but small
customer_reviews.text: This lightweight Mr. Coffee teakettle isn't as hefty as our old one, but it does the job - which is kind of the whole point. It's a teakettle, not a fashion statement. It lets the water get hot and whistles when it's ready. Be aware if you order it that it's on the small side. We use it for two people and it's barely big enough for us. I do like it, but my next teakettle I'm going up a size or going electric, can't decide which. This is an old fashioned solution and works well, though, and it looks good while doing its job. What more can you ask?
customer_reviews.author: Twisterjester

customer_reviews.title: Tight Lid, Whistle Isn’t Loud
customer_reviews.text: The whistle isn’t very loud and can’t be heard in the adjoining room. Also the lid snaps closed and is almost too tight as it requires one hand to hold the kettle and the other to manhandle the lid off. I recommend covering the lid with a towel or potholder if you open it when the water is still hot to prevent accidental splash on your hand. But I can’t complain as it was the cheapest one out there and you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: ScubaGal

customer_reviews.title: Rust spots; Hot handle
customer_reviews.text: Great look. Easy clean Handle gets hot if heated to boil water when filled 3/4 way to full capacity. Rust marks after approximately a year of use (see image). No rust inside the product. Advertised as stainless steel but I guess this only applies to inside the product. Recommend buying another product and manufacture correct false advertising
customer_reviews.author: lch

customer_reviews.title: Ok tea kettle, but has problems
customer_reviews.text: This little kettle works great, with one big exception. The whistler spout which is made a hard plastic is not very heat resistant. I had to stop using high heat to get it the kettle to whistle as the flame was slowly being disfigured by the heat, and wasn’t always whistling. Would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mary K.

customer_reviews.title: Not for left handed people
customer_reviews.text: Nice tea kettle but not for left handed people. The handle has tab stops on the right side of handle so when a right handed person is pouring the handle stops in the up position. If a left handed person is pouring w their left hand, the handle tilts and boiling water goes everywhere which is a hazard and a good chance you might get burned.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Form and Function Go Hand In Hand
customer_reviews.text: The teapot does what it is needed, is durable and harmonizes with the kitchen decor. However, the handle is made of plastic, rigid in design (it is cast in an immovable, vertical position) and absorbs heat which makes it something of an endurance test when I’m pouring my tea in the morning. This design flaw reduces the value a little for me, as it would most likely require an oven holder to use with comfort. Or, if you are a proponent of performative masculinity as I sometimes am...
customer_reviews.author: Bibliophile MK XXXVII

customer_reviews.title: Cheap feel; hot handle
customer_reviews.text: It is much thinner than the Bed, Bath, and Beyond kettle that I had, which means that it heats the water much faster but it has a cheap feel to it. It is also very noisy while the water is being heated. The only significant concern that I have is that the black handle get hot (it should be much better insulated) and you should not grab it with your bare hand.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Donahue

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and Durable!
customer_reviews.text: The Mr. Coffee Stainless Steel kettle is fantastic! It has been a great addition to my kitchen because I do not have a water filtration system. With this I am able to boil my water and not have to go buy drinkable water every time. It has been a great help! Not only that but its design and quality outweighs the price at which it comes for. For less than 10 dollars you are receiving a quality kettle made from a scratch resistant stainless steal which looks very modern. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Wyman

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold up well
customer_reviews.text: After using this for a little over a month to boil water, it looks like I found it in a dumpster. The knob on the lid melted off, the metal is discolored, and the whistling spout cover fell off. I scrubbed it with a brillo pad before taking the photo...not much change. I guess I will put a new knob on the lid and use it until the next part breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Julia San Diego

customer_reviews.title: Black plastic parts melting away
customer_reviews.text: Check and make sure your stovetop flame stay within the bottom surface of the pot or the handles and sprout will melt away. I did not know that and set my stovetop on high on the first day and the bottom part of the handle melted. I set the flame on medium but days later the sprout was burned and melted. I will probably toss it and get a different brand better designed for larger stovetop.
customer_reviews.author: josiesf

customer_reviews.title: Okay construction- Whistle needs work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kettle because I like the way it looks, and the red color is great. I really wanted a kettle with a whistle so that I don't forget about it. It is a poor seal and I can sort of bend it into place to work, but I need to do that every time I fill or use the kettle. I haven't thrown it out, but I did buy a new kettle (different brand).
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Wekell

customer_reviews.title: Handle gets super hot
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the handle gets SUPER hot and I need an oven mit or towel just to pour my hot water. I would not purchase this again - I would want one that is functional without burning my hand when pouring.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Horrible! Not at all what I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered (or thought I was ordering) the tea kettle on the Instruction booklet. This cheap thing I received is a 3rd degree burn waiting to happen. The handle flops back and forth... What does a "flip up spout cover" even mean? What kind of sorry contraption is this? No, no, no! Don't waste your money. This is definitely a cheap joke. I'm returning it immediately!
customer_reviews.author: The Truth

customer_reviews.title: Happy but Confused
customer_reviews.text: I used this less than a dozen times and it appears that the plastic piece the covers the spout has melted (I don't know how or why). You can tell that it's thinner and cheaper, especially in comparison to other kettles I have had. I feel regret that I didn't spend the extra $5 - $15 to get a nicer kettle or an electric kettle.
customer_reviews.author: PeepsAndTreats

customer_reviews.title: GREAT tea kettle, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the price. I spent lots of money on a copper tea kettle that I had to keep cleaning and did no better at hearing water. This is lightweight, attractive and with an excellent whistle. Water boils rapidly. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Louise D. Somes

customer_reviews.title: Updated Review-
customer_reviews.text: Kettle is awesome. I know some reviews say that the pot rust, but it’s metal and if you leave water in it yes it will rust. This is a great kettle for an amazing price. It whistles when the water is boiling and the handle stays cool which is a plus when pouring boiling liquid. No need for a potholder
customer_reviews.author: ShoVaughn

customer_reviews.title: PIECE OF JUNK! Doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: I have health issues & can't stand over a stove waiting for hot water. I paid for a whistling tea kettle and this thing NEVER WHISTLED! I left it on and forgot about it. I clocked, it was on the stove for 18 minutes and it NEVER WHISTLED. I WASTED THE COST OF THE KETTLE PLUS SHIPPING AND HANDLING FOR SOMETHING THAT DOESN'T WORK!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dee F.

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest way to boil water
customer_reviews.text: This is the cheapest way I could find to boil water when I got to my vacation rental and they didn't have a pot. It's very cheaply made and the handle is flimsy, but if you just need to get some water to 212 F/100C without anything fancy this will 100% do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: chet

customer_reviews.title: Works great for boiling water but
customer_reviews.text: Works great for boiling water but unless remember to put the handle straight up you can burn your hand lifting it off the stove. Instructions do say to use a potholder. I was looking for a whistling pot and was disappointed when my pot does not whistle! Other than that it hits the water perfectly and I use it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Danita Rae

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I like the look and ergonomics of this kettle. The handle and switch to lift the steam cap seem durable and are very convenient to use. The brushed stainless steel look is great for my kitchen. My only regret is not about the kettle but about my own hard water and the marks it leaves. Just takes some vinegar and wiping occasionally as it does show hard water after a few uses. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Blithe

customer_reviews.title: Not really a whistle
customer_reviews.text: This pot heats water as advertised but the nostalgic whistle does not exist. The sound is more like a high pitch screech. The pot look a bit thin. the handle mechanism is nice to avoid burning oneself. I still miss the whistle from pots I had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Kakou

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed! While looking for a new teapot
customer_reviews.text: The inside bottom of this kettle immediately had a green scale embedded in the bottom of the stainless steel. I continued to use it for awhile but eventually realized that (the inside bottom) was also flaking. Very disappointed! While looking for a new teapot, I noticed that this one is still being sold on Amazon and I decided to share our experience with potential buyers. BTW, I am very careful and clean, this was not my error in any way except for buying it. The steel in the pot that I purchased is inferior.
customer_reviews.author: CMD

customer_reviews.title: Best to know the details first
customer_reviews.text: This kettle was the right size but not fashioned so that one could open to pour without encountering a hot steam spout first. I could leave the whistle open but that does defeat its purpose. Since I wanted something small and easy to lift, I did get that, and for the time being the price was low and it's still a shiny new kettle.
customer_reviews.author: lucille f. travis

customer_reviews.title: Boils water
customer_reviews.text: I normally use my Keurig to boil water for tea, but, when it comes to making instant oatmeal, it just isn't hot enough. With the winter coming, we eat a lot of oatmeal. The package arrived quickly, was packaged nicely, and the stainless steel matches my stove. Great capacity for water, and actually heats up the water rather quickly.
customer_reviews.author: dianefromri

customer_reviews.title: Typical of Amazon products
customer_reviews.text: Whistle does not work, I ran it dry the first time. Now I keep my eye on it. It holds water and can be heated, so it is functional. Is it worth the effort to return no - I simply won't buy an item like this from Amazon again. Returns are easier at brick and mortar stores.
customer_reviews.author: mb

customer_reviews.title: Rusted, waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Rusted within 1 week of use. Unfortunately this was a gift and wasn't used until long past the return date. Complete waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: agentshearer

customer_reviews.title: Makes great tea!
customer_reviews.text: This is really a great product. I received it as a gift, and have used it multiple times with no complaints. It boils easily, and even though it warns to not touch the plastic handle after boiling, it was not hot (this may depend on the type of stove you're using), and overall makes great tea. The only negatives I can possibly see are: -It doesn't whistle very loud. It's best to stay in the same room while it's boiling. ...and that's about it. This is a great tea kettle, and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: LemonCat

customer_reviews.title: Even with drying, starts rusting after just one use
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, it rusts very quickly. Since I rarely use a teapot (so it spends most of its time dry) and I knew about this issue ahead of time, I didn't expect to be bothered by this. But after using it one time and leaving it open to dry out quickly, it still started showing rust. (I filled it with reverse osmosis filtered water, so there wasn't anything about the water that would have encouraged rusting.) So unless you are an extremely infrequent user of teapots, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Simcha-Yitzchak Lerner

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy. Bad quality.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tea kettle about 4 months ago and I've been using it almost everyday. After a couple months, it started rusting. Pieces of the metal started flaking off slightly and it started going into my tea. Very disappointed with the considering it's a very short life span and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Denise T.

customer_reviews.title: But it just seems like if it's on the burner too long it might ...
customer_reviews.text: The base of the kettle is extremely thin, even thinner than what a tin can might be.... or at least it seems awfully flimsy. I haven't actually used it yet so for that I can't comment. But it just seems like if it's on the burner too long it might spring a leak, the metal is so thin. I shall see.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz T.

customer_reviews.title: wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: I am in Assisted Living and due to lovely Covid 19 I am isolated in my room quite a bit. But it's for safety for everyone living here. This awesome Teapot was an idea I came up with. I love coffee, a lot. Because I cannot leave my room I cannot get a cup of coffee when I want one. Teapot to the rescue. My health aide's will fill it up so I can have some coffee during the day and evening. Wonderful product. I love it! (also because we are not allowed to have coffee makers in our rooms) Thank you
customer_reviews.author: connie viccione

customer_reviews.title: Nice design
customer_reviews.text: Flintshire has a stable wide bottom, boils fast. Whistle loud enough without being annoying. Handle stays cool, with trigger well away from the spout, and stays open if need be. Dry with paper towel after it cools. Nice affordable tea kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this tea kettle
customer_reviews.text: I have had this tea kettle for less than a month and have used it a handful of times. It is already rusting inside the kettle. I love that it is light and attractive but the rusting interior is not acceptable. I'm hoping to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Meggie

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Color is pretty. What I don't like about the kettle is I have to pull off the spout in order to pour. In hindsight I would not get this again I made some assumptions that the pour spout was all in one.
customer_reviews.author: TMB

customer_reviews.title: Expect a hot handle and some rust
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what I wanted, low cost, easy to maintain tea kettle 3 stars and not 5 because 1)there's already some rust forming along the inside seam 2) by the time the whistle sounds, the handle is friggin hot! Product claims this will not happen. My hands have determined that this is a lie. Still a decent product for the price, especially as I wanted a metal kettle as opposed to one made of glass (my two cats can't be trusted with glass)
customer_reviews.author: JessicaTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: The whistle is good and loud
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say. It's a kettle. The whistle is good and loud, it pours well, and has a nice appearance. No sign of rust. We empty it when we are finished using it and leave the lid off to let the inside dry out. It's great. Also the spout/whistle cap mechanism is good and does not stick. Best whistling kettle we have ever had. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Scottish Kate from Virginia.

customer_reviews.title: I love this kettle.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed for a visiting relative that requires instant coffee. I love the handle and how quickly it heats up the water when placed on the burner. I feel this was a great purchase for me and the price was not bad either.
customer_reviews.author: Angela H. Gramer

customer_reviews.title: Tea kettle
customer_reviews.text: As a kid growing up, I heard the sound of the tea kettle every day when I woke up. My folks would drink tea all the time. So, I grew up and had my own home, but for some reason never got around to getting a kettle. I saw this one on Amazon and just had to have it. It didn't disappoint. Not I have the 'whistle' in my kitchen every day, and it;s pretty too.
customer_reviews.author: James Mackey

customer_reviews.title: Questionable Quality
customer_reviews.text: Wants to be a REAL whistling kettle when it grows up. Looks so pretty, but lid is very difficult to remove. And it does not whistle. The spout is hard to pull off. Love the color and size, but I need to hear it when I'm moving about the house. This could be dangerous for those hard of hearing. Water boils away, dry kettle starts to burn--- you get the picture. I'll use it for a while since I boil water only a few times per week. Don't think it will be very durable. Thin and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Easy Reader

customer_reviews.title: Whistling Kettle a real Convenience
customer_reviews.text: We really like the whistle factor in this kettle. We know when the water is hot enough for our tea instead of just guessing. The kettle is easy to clean and we always leave on or near the stove as we drink tea often.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Handle
customer_reviews.text: This teapot is pleasing to the eye. It heats up nicely, and it has a whistle that signals when the water boils. The handle is sturdy, easy to hold and doesn't get too hot, as long as you don't boil the water too long. I love this teapot.
customer_reviews.author: Ducky

customer_reviews.title: The little kettle that could
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! It heats my water! And then I use the water for tea or hot cocoa! It whistles too! After the first use, I thought the whistling feature broke, but it turned out I had to wait longer for it to fully heat up and whistle. I think it's because I was adding cold water so it took longer. The plastic handle gets hot! So be careful! Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Adriel Romo

customer_reviews.title: OK pot..not great
customer_reviews.text: Handle moves way too much and is riveted on so it cannot be tightened. When pouring hot water this might be a safety issue. Inexpensive. Cleans up nice but I have not had it long. Get what you pay for I guess. 3-star at best.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HAND DRY AFTER USE
customer_reviews.text: I drink tea a lot. So, I tend to use my tea kettles about every day. I bought this kettle for is's high water capacity. However, about 2-3 months after purchase, it started to rust after I let it out to dry after washing it. So, I stopped using it, unfortunately. I had used it a bit so I wasn't going to return it, but you must HAND-DRY thoroughly to make the kettle last longer. So, go for copper or dry this one as soon as you're finished washing it/using it. :-) I went for a glass one as they don't rust, which is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I don't normally write reviews but this one deserves it. I bought this held for my mom about a year ago and pretty quickly the top warped, it stopped whistling, and the inside bottom is coming off in little chips that I'm glad I noticed. Who knows how long she's been drinking tiny little chips she couldn't yet see. I have no idea because it looks like it's been doing for a while. This is infuriating. All I wanted was to get her a little kettle for coffee. I guess you can't go for the cheaper option or you'll be poisoned.
customer_reviews.author: Supora

customer_reviews.title: RUST.
customer_reviews.text: Product has rusted after 2 - 3 weeks of light use. I got this mid July, only heated water about 3 times, and would wash out the water and dry it regularly after use. Unacceptable. Should have read other reviews. No idea why this is rated so high.
customer_reviews.author: N.Bae

customer_reviews.title: Whispering kettle!
customer_reviews.text: I'm forced to edit my original review. The first whistling kettle only whispered, but it's replacement screams! This is an inexpensive kettle, so you get what you pay for, I would have rated it higher if it had a better-insulated handle. Amazon definitely did their part by sending out the replacement promptly.
customer_reviews.author: Climber3000

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, reliable, great price
customer_reviews.text: I was put off initially by the cheap price, but decided to give it a shot since I didn't want to spend much on a kettle anyway. While surely not the best kettle out there, this kettle definitely meets my needs for a really good price. It's light weight, it heats water reliably, and whistles when ready. The lid comes off, the inside is easily cleaned, and the handle doesn't get hot when heating water. If you're not looking for a pretty kettle with neat designs and features, this one should definitely meet your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Alt_key

customer_reviews.title: Great tea kettle for the price
customer_reviews.text: I do intermittent fasting so I like to have tea with lemon in the morning because it doesn’t break the fast. So I bought this tea kettle because the cost and because it’s stainless steel. It’s very easy to clean and quickly heats. The handle is easy to pour, the lid is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Penny.miniaussie

customer_reviews.title: Works well, does the job
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, shiny color - like a ruby. Much more beautiful than in the picture. The handle folds down to fill the pot, it whistles, and you remove the piece covering the spout to pour. I thought it would be annoying to have an extra piece, but I think it's better because you avoid getting a steam burn from holding open a spout cover with a thumb tab. It seems like it will last for quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received this tea kettle as a Christmas gift. It is very light weight but the biggest problem is when you wash it! I hand washed tea kettle in a sink of warm water (not hot) and the paint started coming off. DO NOT purchase because you will me writing a 1 star review next!!!!
customer_reviews.author: R.T.

customer_reviews.title: This teapot fills the bill for my purposes since I ...
customer_reviews.text: This teapot fills the bill for my purposes since I only heat one cup at a time for coffee or tea, but it's awfully thin metal and very lightweight. It takes longer to heat than the previous, thicker one I had which broke. The whistle on this one sometimes doesn't work but I'm in the kitchen the whole time anyway, so that doesn't matter.
customer_reviews.author: Shakti

customer_reviews.title: Easy and worth it, only complaint is the handle that gets a bit too hot to the touch
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is that the handle gets a bit too hot to use without a cloth or mitt. Great for the price, heats up water quickly and of course the whistle helps me not forget that I’ve got water heating on the stovetop.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: It’s a good kettle.
customer_reviews.text: This is a kettle that gets the job done. It works just as expected but is not a big kettle. I use it to boil water for tea and it is perfect for me. It’s easy to clean and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sewingsisco

customer_reviews.title: Saddest whistling teapot ever! Way over priced for it!
customer_reviews.text: Feels cheap, even for this thin stainless steel! Water leaks from pour spout. Whistle is just pitiful and more like a whining than a anything else! I do NOT recommend it at all! Except do not buy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Pure Garbage -- RUSTS! Get one without seams at the base!
customer_reviews.text: I should've read the reviews before purchasing. Instead I just looked at the overall stars. This started rusting after 2 months of normal use! JUNK. See the pics! It feels cheap and is cheap. Bad quality materials. Thin & not-so-stainless steel. Handle gets hot and/or melts at where it connects. Terrible kettle. Will never buy this brand again. UPDATE: If you get a kettle without seams at the base/where water rests, it won't rust. This started to rust at the seams.
customer_reviews.author: TruthBringer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: My main need is to boil water for tea. The whistle fell out of this kettle almost immediately, and subsequently, the screws holding the spout on have also failed. It is very difficult to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Raejean French

customer_reviews.title: loud whistle so if I walk away I can hear it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Whistle sound is very weak. If you're not standing next to the kettle you may not hear it. It takes a while to whistle even when steam is coming out of the whistle spout and water is boiling. What's the use of whistling kettle if you can't hear it ... it and it takes too long to begin whistling after water is boiling. Buy another brand. One that guarantees an audible whistle. I'm going to attempt to return...very disappointed. Waste of my time and money,
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Does not really whistle.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this based on price and a review that said it was good value. The only problem with this "whistling" tea kettle is that it does not really whistle - it wheezes and not very loudly at that. I've had tea kettles in the past where you could hear the whistling on the other side of the house. You have to be in the kitchen to hear this one. Other than that it is okay. Not worth the trouble of sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Description is wrong!  it's NOT DISHWASHER SAFE!
customer_reviews.text: I know this is not a high quality tea kettle. But I spent more on a higher quality one and it didn't last. So I figured if this lasts maybe 6 months I got my money's worth. It is stainless steel. However even though the description on Amazon says it's dishwasher safe on the package it comes in it says it's NOT DISHWASHER SAFE!! So that needs to be changed.
customer_reviews.author: Mt girl

customer_reviews.title: Top on Spout Broke after 2nd use
customer_reviews.text: My kitchen is red and black - this is why I brought this It did not whistle and the top on the spout broke after just 2 uses - see picture. I kept using because I thought hey it matches my kitchen and it still boils water so what the heck why return it. But the handle is suppose to be heat resistance but it gets hot as Hell0, Do not but this kettle and I am going to review the french coffee press I brought with this that the handle came off also. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Kettle!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome color and love this Kettle! Its a great product and is not made cheap. The only reason I gave 4 stars is because Ive washed it a couple of times and there are a few areas where the paint has started to come off. Other than that, a great kettle to use!
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Don't listen to the bad reviewes this is a great kettle for the price
customer_reviews.author: James Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Water stains forever I would not buy
customer_reviews.text: I wish I returned while I could. The tea kettle will never look like it did when you first bought it. Hand washed only..the water marks are stained on the tea kettle and will never go away. I’ve tried everything.
customer_reviews.author: Kindra

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but hope that the oily film is a fluke.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality build on this kettle. Performs as expected. The only thing that worried me at first was an oily film on the inside of the kettle. It took two solid fills/boils plus soap and scrubbing to remove this film. Thankfully it didn't leave any residual taste or odor that I can detect. There was a lot of extra work involved to make it usable though. Should have been as simple as a quick rinse before the first use instead of an hour of manual labor.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hunley Hurst

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Really nice teapot, good loud whistle, for the money , a very sturdy pot! Purchased 2, one was a gift, recipient also loved it!! Rich red, complements my kitchen!! Wise purchase!!! Sometimes you luck out with a purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: Thru my eyes!!!

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful bright red tea kettle
customer_reviews.text: Since I always write reviews for the products I order, I started to write this one and thought, what could I possibly say? It works fine, the whistle removes to pour the water, the red is a gorgeous color, and I'm very pleased that I found this at a good price here.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Ryker
